subtitle: hi this is Simon Jacobsen and welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question this
week is about judgmentalism I struggle
with judging others how can I become
less judgmental an excellent question
unfortunately that too many people are
guilty of but judgmentalism when you
analyze it and dissect it it really
comes down to this when a person is
really secure with themselves they have
no reason and need to be judgmental of
others because they have their own
identity and they're not in any way
insecure or envious or jealous of any
one's other's position but when you are
insecure and you struggle with your own
self they become very prone to be
judgmental and critical of everyone else
so judgmentalism in anyone's life is an
opportunity to look inside your heart
and soul and figure out what do you
stand for if you can't answer that
question what do I stand for what do I
believe in what causes am I ready to
fight for what am i passionate about
rest assured you're very likely going to
be criticizing others because you don't
have your own identity so the easiest
thing to do is to criticize someone
else's now there are times we other
people do things that to deserve
challenge and do deserve perhaps
judgment but we're not the ones that
sits in judgment each of us have our own
weaknesses and flaws when we judge
others then in a sense we're bringing on
their judgment upon us the healthiest
thing to do especially if you care about
someone is not to judge them but to try
to help improve the situation but again
that comes down to being secure if
you're insecure you usually will not be
involved in a productive and
constructive type of criticism it'll be
a criticism by saying that you know if
you're wrong I may be then right really
healthy people secure people don't need
others to be wrong for them to be right
unfortunately we live in a very insecure
world with all our technologies with all
our comforts there's a certain erosion
on the inner self maybe into to the fact
that growing up in homes where our
parents did not validate us or criticize
maybe it's due to other factors in
society the dog eats dog mentality
regardless for the rate of the reason
but judgmentalism is an outgrowth of
byproducts of inner insecurities inner
lack of confidence and that's what one
has to do to begin to challenge your own
judgmentalism to figure out what do you
stand for what do you believe in what
makes you tick why are you here and why
are you indispensable in the big
equation that you have something to give
and no one else but you can give when
you have that type of attitude you will
judge people far less or not at all
this has been meaningful Monday's thank
you for watching if you'd like to submit
your personal question please click on
the link below
everyone have a very meaningful
you
